ground_truth: At this question, he rises and looks through the doorway. Escobar sees him and ignores him. Evelyn looks up to see Gittes standing in the doorway only a foot or two from her, and she stops cold. Escobar is right at her back. They look at one another for a long moment, and Gittes says nothing. She finishes, looks plaintively at Gittes, and Evelyn nods slightly as Escobar coughs. Gittes picks up the sheet and pulls it back, revealing eyes open and a face that is badly cut and bruised. They begin to walk slowly, and again have to move out of the way as some other corpse is being wheeled out of one of the Coroner cubicles. Morty is wheeling in another body with the help of an assistant. Morty pulls back the sheet, brushes some sand from the man's face, and laughs. As he begins to move the body into the refrigerator, he breaks into a wrenching spasm of coughing and Morty shrugs. The Boy doesn't answer, but then nods. The horse snorts, and The Boy rides slowly on. Gittes scrambles up the embankment to note the direction the storm drain by Hollenbeck Bridge takes. It is headed above toward the Hollywood Hills, where the sun is setting, along the flood channel. It is dark now and Gittes follows the channel with the car spotlight. The road is dirt, with heavy clusters of oak trees and eucalyptus everywhere. Another turn reveals a pie-shaped view of a lake of lights in the city below, over the road, bolted. He turns at a fork in the road which allows him to continue following the flood channel. The road is narrower and Gittes drives more slowly. The chain-link itself actually extends over the flood channel and down into it, making access along the channel itself impossible. Gittes backs up, turns off the motor, the car lights, and the spotlight. Alone light overhead on tension wires is the sole illumination. Gittes gets out of the car, clubs the fence near the Flood channel itself. Lights from the reservoir still higher above can be seen. Gittes carefully works his way up through the thick foliage toward a second and large chain-link fence. He dives into the flood control channel, which is at this point about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes loses himself among the ivy in the channel and starts to lift his head to catch the direction. Then he's inundated with a rush of water which pours over him, knocks off his hat, and carries him down the channel, banging into its banks, as he desperately tries to grab some of the overgrowth to hang on and pull himself out, but the force of the stream batters him and carries him with it until he's brought rudely to the chain-link fence.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: At this inquiry, he ascends and gazes through the entrance. Escobar perceives him and disregards him. Evelyn glances up to witness Gittes standing in the entryway merely a foot or two from her, and she halts abruptly. Escobar is directly at her back. They gaze at one another for an extended moment, and Gittes utters nothing. She concludes, looks wistfully at Gittes, and Evelyn inclines slightly as Escobar clears his throat. Gittes lifts the sheet and draws it back, exposing eyes open and a visage that is severely cut and battered. They commence to amble slowly, and once more have to shift out of the path as some other cadaver is being rolled out of one of the Coroner cubicles. Morty is rolling in another corpse with the assistance of an aide. Morty draws back the sheet, brushes some grit from the man's visage, and chuckles. As he starts to move the corpse into the cooler, he breaks into a wrenching spasm of coughing and Morty shrugs. The Boy doesn't respond, but then nods. The horse snorts, and The Boy rides slowly on. Gittes scrambles up the slope to observe the direction the tempest drain by Hollenbeck Bridge takes. It is headed upward toward the Hollywood Hills, where the sun is descending, along the deluge channel. It is dark now and Gittes follows the channel with the vehicle beam. The road is dirt, with dense clusters of oak trees and eucalyptus everywhere. Another turn reveals a pie-shaped vista of a lake of lights in the metropolis below, over the road, bolted. He turns at a fork in the road which allows him to continue following the deluge channel. The road is narrower and Gittes drives more slowly. The chain-link itself actually extends over the deluge channel and down into it, making access along the channel itself impossible. Gittes reverses, turns off the motor, the car lights, and the beam. One light overhead on tension wires is the sole illumination. Gittes gets out of the car, clubs the barrier near the Deluge channel itself. Lights from the reservoir still higher above can be seen. Gittes carefully works his way up through the thick foliage toward a second and sizable chain-link barrier. He plunges into the deluge control channel, which is at this point about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes loses himself among the ivy in the channel and starts to lift his head to discern the orientation. Then he's inundated with a rush of water which pours over him, knocks off his hat, and carries him down the channel, banging into its banks, as he desperately tries to seize some of the overgrowth to cling on and pull himself out, but the force of the current batters him and carries him with it until he's brought rudely to the chain-link barrier.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: At this question, he rises and looks through the doorway. Escobar sees and ignores him. Evelyn notices Gittes standing just a foot or two away and stops cold. Escobar is right behind her. They exchange a long look, and Gittes remains silent. She finishes, looks plaintively at Gittes, and nods slightly as Escobar coughs. Gittes lifts the sheet, revealing a face with open eyes, badly cut and bruised. They walk slowly, moving aside as another corpse is wheeled out of a Coroner cubicle. Morty, with an assistant, wheels in another body, brushes sand from the man's face, and laughs. As he moves the body into the refrigerator, he coughs violently, and Morty shrugs. The Boy doesn't answer but nods. The horse snorts, and The Boy rides on slowly. Gittes scrambles up the embankment to note the storm drain's direction by Hollenbeck Bridge. It heads toward the Hollywood Hills, where the sun sets along the flood channel. It's dark now, and Gittes follows the channel with the car spotlight. The dirt road is lined with oak and eucalyptus trees. Another turn reveals a pie-shaped view of city lights below. He turns at a fork to continue following the flood channel. The road narrows, and Gittes drives more slowly. The chain-link extends over and into the flood channel, blocking access. Gittes backs up, turns off the motor, car lights, and spotlight. A lone light on tension wires provides illumination. Gittes exits the car, clubs the fence near the flood channel. Lights from the reservoir above are visible. Gittes carefully moves through thick foliage toward a second large chain-link fence. He dives into the flood control channel, about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes hides among the ivy, lifts his head to catch the direction, then a rush of water pours over him, knocking off his hat and carrying him down the channel. He bangs into the banks, desperately trying to grab overgrowth to pull himself out, but the stream's force batters him until he's brought to the chain-link fence.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: At the question, he rises and looks through the doorway. Escobar sees and ignores him. Evelyn notices Gittes standing nearby and stops. Escobar is behind her. They exchange a long look, and Gittes remains silent. She finishes, looks at Gittes, and nods as Escobar coughs. Gittes uncovers a face, revealing open eyes and bruises. They walk slowly, moving aside for a corpse being wheeled out. Morty, with an assistant, brings in another body, brushes sand off the face, laughs, and coughs. The Boy nods as the horse snorts, riding slowly on. Gittes climbs the embankment to track the storm drain by Hollenbeck Bridge toward the Hollywood Hills at sunset. It's dark, and he follows the channel with a car spotlight. The dirt road is lined with oak and eucalyptus. A turn shows city lights below. He takes a fork to follow the channel, driving slowly on the narrow road. The chain-link fence extends over the channel, blocking access. Gittes stops, turns off the car, and clubs the fence. Reservoir lights are visible above. He climbs through foliage to a second fence, dives into the flood channel, and is swept by water, losing his hat. He struggles against the current, trying to grab overgrowth, but is carried to the chain-link fence.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: At the moment when this particular question is posed, he stands up and gazes through the open doorway. Escobar, who is already aware of his presence, chooses to disregard him entirely. Evelyn, noticing the movement, glances up to find Gittes standing there, positioned just a mere foot or two away from her. She halts abruptly, frozen in place. Escobar is positioned directly behind her, close enough to feel his presence. They exchange a long, meaningful look, a silent communication passing between them, yet Gittes remains silent, choosing not to utter a single word. Evelyn completes her task, then looks at Gittes with a pleading expression, and gives a slight nod as Escobar clears his throat with a cough. Gittes then lifts the sheet, pulling it back to reveal a face with eyes wide open, marred by severe cuts and bruises. They begin to walk at a slow pace, and once again, they must step aside to make way for another corpse being wheeled out from one of the Coroner's cubicles. Morty, accompanied by an assistant, is maneuvering another body into the room. Morty pulls back the sheet, brushes away some sand from the man's face, and lets out a laugh. As he proceeds to move the body into the refrigerator, he is overtaken by a violent coughing fit, to which Morty merely shrugs. The Boy remains silent, but eventually gives a nod. The horse lets out a snort, and The Boy continues to ride slowly onward. Gittes scrambles up the embankment to observe the direction in which the storm drain near Hollenbeck Bridge is headed. It is leading upward toward the Hollywood Hills, where the sun is setting, casting a glow along the flood channel. Darkness has now fallen, and Gittes follows the channel using the car's spotlight to guide him. The road is unpaved, with dense clusters of oak trees and eucalyptus scattered throughout the area. Another turn in the road reveals a pie-shaped view of a lake of lights from the city below, stretching over the road, bolted in place. He takes a turn at a fork in the road, allowing him to continue tracing the path of the flood channel. The road narrows, prompting Gittes to drive with increased caution. The chain-link fence extends over the flood channel and descends into it, making direct access along the channel itself impossible. Gittes reverses the car, turns off the engine, the headlights, and the spotlight. A solitary light overhead, suspended on tension wires, provides the only illumination. Gittes exits the vehicle and strikes the fence near the flood channel. Lights from the reservoir, situated even higher above, are still visible. Gittes carefully navigates his way through the dense foliage toward a second, larger chain-link fence. He dives into the flood control channel, which at this point measures about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes becomes obscured among the ivy in the channel and begins to lift his head to determine the direction. Suddenly, he is overwhelmed by a surge of water that cascades over him, knocking off his hat and sweeping him down the channel. He collides with the banks, desperately attempting to grasp the overgrowth to hold on and pull himself out, but the powerful current batters him and continues to carry him along until he is abruptly stopped by the chain-link fence.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: At the precise moment when this particular question arises, he makes the decision to stand up. He turns his gaze purposefully through the open doorway. Escobar, fully aware of his presence and standing nearby, opts to completely disregard him, choosing not to acknowledge his presence at all. Evelyn, catching sight of the movement in her peripheral vision, looks up to see Gittes standing there, positioned just a mere foot or two in front of her. She comes to a sudden and abrupt halt, frozen in place momentarily. Escobar is positioned directly behind her, close enough for his presence to be palpable. They exchange a long, lingering look full of unspoken significance, a silent communication passing naturally between them. Despite this, Gittes chooses to remain silent, opting not to utter a single word in response. Evelyn finishes her task, then turns her attention back to Gittes with a pleading expression on her face, offering him a slight nod just as Escobar clears his throat with a noticeable cough. Gittes then proceeds to lift the sheet, gently pulling it back to expose a face with eyes wide open, tragically marred by severe cuts and bruises. They begin to walk at a slow, deliberate pace, and once again, they have to step aside to make way for yet another corpse being wheeled out from one of the Coroner’s cubicles. Morty, along with an assistant, is guiding another body into the room. Morty pulls back the sheet, brushing away some sand from the man’s face, and then lets out a laugh. As he continues to move the body into the refrigerator, he is suddenly overtaken by a violent coughing fit, to which Morty merely shrugs with indifference. The Boy remains silent, but after a moment, he eventually gives a nod of understanding. The horse responds with a snort, and The Boy continues to ride steadily onward, maintaining his path. Gittes scrambles up the embankment in order to observe the direction in which the storm drain near Hollenbeck Bridge is headed. It is leading upward in the direction of the Hollywood Hills, where the sun is setting, casting a warm glow along the flood channel. Darkness has by now descended, and Gittes follows the channel using the car’s spotlight to guide him carefully through the dusk. The road is unpaved and surrounded by dense clusters of oak trees and eucalyptus, scattered throughout the area in abundance. As he rounds another turn in the road, a pie-shaped view of a lake of twinkling city lights is revealed, stretching over the road, bolted in place. He takes a cautious turn at a fork in the road, allowing him to continue tracing the winding path of the flood channel. The road begins to narrow, prompting Gittes to drive with increased caution and vigilance. The chain-link fence extends over the flood channel and descends into it, making any direct access along the channel itself impossible. Gittes reverses the car, turns off the engine, and extinguishes both the headlights and the spotlight. A solitary light, suspended overhead on tension wires, serves as the only source of illumination. Gittes exits the vehicle and strikes the fence near the flood channel with determination. Lights from the reservoir, situated even higher above, remain visible in the distance. Gittes carefully navigates his way through the dense foliage toward a second, larger chain-link fence. He bravely dives into the flood control channel, which at this point measures about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes becomes obscured among the ivy in the channel and begins to lift his head to orient himself and determine the direction. Suddenly, he is overwhelmed by a powerful surge of water that cascades over him, knocking off his hat and sweeping him violently down the channel. He collides painfully with the banks, desperately attempting to grasp the overgrowth to hold on and pull himself out, but the powerful current batters him relentlessly and continues to carry him along until he is abruptly halted by the chain-link fence.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: At the moment the question is posed, he rises from his seat and directs his gaze through the doorway, taking in the scene before him. Escobar, noticing his presence, chooses to disregard him entirely. Evelyn, sensing a change, lifts her eyes to find Gittes standing in the doorway, mere feet away from her, causing her to halt abruptly. Escobar stands closely behind her, creating a tense atmosphere. They exchange a prolonged, silent look, during which Gittes remains speechless. Evelyn completes her task, then turns her gaze toward Gittes with a look of silent appeal, and gives a slight nod as Escobar clears his throat with a cough. Gittes then reaches for the sheet, grasping it firmly before pulling it back to reveal a face marred by severe cuts and bruises, with eyes staring blankly. They begin to walk at a slow pace, carefully navigating their path, and are forced to step aside as another corpse is wheeled out from one of the Coroner's cubicles. Morty, accompanied by an assistant, maneuvers another body into the room. He deftly pulls back the sheet covering the body, brushes away some sand from the man's face, and lets out a laugh. As he proceeds to move the body into the refrigerator, he is suddenly overtaken by a violent coughing fit, to which Morty responds with a nonchalant shrug. The Boy, initially silent, eventually nods in response. The horse, sensing the moment, snorts, and The Boy continues to ride slowly onward. Meanwhile, Gittes scrambles up the embankment, intent on observing the direction in which the storm drain by Hollenbeck Bridge leads. He notes that it heads upward toward the Hollywood Hills, where the sun is setting, casting a glow along the flood channel. As darkness falls, Gittes follows the channel, illuminating his path with the car's spotlight. The road beneath him is composed of dirt, flanked by dense clusters of oak and eucalyptus trees. As he navigates another turn, a pie-shaped view of a lake of city lights unfolds below him, with the road appearing bolted in place. He reaches a fork in the road, choosing the path that allows him to continue trailing the flood channel. The road narrows, prompting Gittes to reduce his speed. The chain-link fence extends over the flood channel and descends into it, rendering direct access along the channel impossible. Gittes reverses the car, then turns off the engine, extinguishing the car lights and the spotlight, leaving only a solitary light overhead on tension wires to illuminate the scene. Exiting the car, Gittes approaches the fence near the flood channel and strikes it with a club. From his vantage point, he can see the lights from the reservoir situated higher up. He cautiously makes his way through the dense foliage toward a second, larger chain-link fence. With determination, he dives into the flood control channel, which at this point measures about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes becomes obscured among the ivy within the channel, attempting to lift his head to discern the direction. Suddenly, a torrent of water surges over him, dislodging his hat and propelling him down the channel. He collides with the banks, struggling to grasp the overgrowth in a bid to anchor himself and pull free, but the relentless force of the stream batters him, sweeping him along until he is abruptly halted by the chain-link fence.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: At the question, he rises and looks through the doorway, where Escobar sees and ignores him. Evelyn notices Gittes standing nearby and stops, with Escobar right behind her. They exchange a long look, and Gittes remains silent. After Evelyn finishes, she gives Gittes a plaintive look and nods slightly as Escobar coughs. Gittes uncovers a sheet, revealing a face that is badly cut and bruised. They walk slowly, maneuvering around another corpse being wheeled out of a Coroner cubicle. Morty, with an assistant, wheels in another body, brushes sand from the man's face, laughs, and then moves the body into the refrigerator, breaking into a coughing spasm as Morty shrugs. The Boy nods silently and rides on as the horse snorts. Gittes climbs the embankment to observe the storm drain's direction by Hollenbeck Bridge, noting it heads toward the Hollywood Hills as the sun sets. In the dark, he follows the flood channel with the car spotlight along a dirt road lined with oak and eucalyptus trees. A turn reveals a view of city lights below. At a fork, he continues along the flood channel, driving more slowly on the narrower road. The chain-link fence extends over the channel, blocking access. Gittes backs up, turns off the car, and gets out, clubbing the fence near the channel. He carefully navigates through thick foliage to a second large chain-link fence, then dives into the flood control channel. As he lifts his head to orient himself, a rush of water overwhelms him, knocking off his hat and carrying him down the channel. He struggles to grab the overgrowth to pull himself out, but the stream's force batters him until he is stopped by the chain-link fence.

Morty pulls back the sheet, brushes some sand from the man's face, a telltale sign of a beachside misfortune, and laughs. As he begins to move the body into the refrigerator, he breaks into a wrenching spasm of coughing, a habit formed over years of smoking, and Morty shrugs. The Boy doesn't answer, but then nods, his horse trained to understand subtle cues. The horse snorts, accustomed to long rides, and The Boy rides slowly on down the rural path. Gittes scrambles up the embankment to note the direction the storm drain by Hollenbeck Bridge takes, a location famous for its engineering that diverts Los Angeles's seasonal rains. It is headed above toward the Hollywood Hills, where the sun is setting, casting dramatic shadows along the flood channel. It is dark now and Gittes follows the channel with the car spotlight, his instincts guiding him through the tricky terrain. Gittes backs up, turns off the motor, the car lights, and the spotlight, enveloping himself in near-total darkness. Alone light overhead on tension wires is the sole illumination, casting an eerie glow. Gittes gets out of the car, clubs the fence near the Flood channel itself, an act that echoes his often risky methods of bypassing obstacles. Lights from the reservoir still higher above can be seen, a reminder of the precious water supply carefully managed in this arid region. He dives into the flood control channel, which is at this point about four feet deep and six feet wide, a confined space designed to efficiently channel water away from urban areas. Gittes loses himself among the ivy in the channel and starts to lift his head to catch the direction. Then he's inundated with a rush of water which pours over him, knocks off his hat, and carries him down the channel, banging into its banks, as he desperately tries to grab some of the overgrowth to hang on and pull himself out, but the force of the stream batters him and carries him with it until he's brought rudely to the chain-link fence, a sobering end to his perilous trek through the floodwaters.

Morty is wheeling in another body with the help of an assistant. Morty pulls back the sheet brushes some sand from the man's face and laughs. As he begins to move the body into the refrigerator he breaks into a wrenching spasm of coughing and Morty shrugs. The Boy does not answer but then nods. The horse snorts and The Boy rides slowly on. Gittes scrambles up the embankment to note the direction the storm drain by Hollenbeck Bridge takes. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. It is headed above toward the Hollywood Hills where the sun is setting along the flood channel. It is dark now and Gittes follows the channel with the car spotlight. The road is dirt with heavy clusters of oak trees and eucalyptus everywhere. Another turn reveals a pieshaped view of a lake of lights in the city below over the road bolted. He turns at a fork in the road which allows him to continue following the flood channel. The road is narrower and Gittes drives more slowly. The chainlink itself actually extends over the flood channel and down into it making access along the channel itself impossible. Gittes backs up turns off the motor the car lights and the spotlight. Alone light overhead on tension wires is the sole illumination. Gittes gets out of the car clubs the fence near the Flood channel itself. Lights from the reservoir still higher above can be seen. Gittes carefully works his way up through the thick foliage toward a second and large chainlink fence. He dives into the flood control channel which is at this point about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes loses himself among the ivy in the channel and starts to lift his head to catch the direction. Then he is inundated with a rush of water which pours over him knocks off his hat and carries him down the channel banging into its banks as he desperately tries to grab some of the overgrowth to hang on and pull himself out but the force of the stream batters him and carries him with it until he is brought rudely to the chainlink fence.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: At this question he rises and looks through the doorway. Escobar sees him and ignores him. Evelyn looks up to see Gittes standing in the doorway only a foot or two from her and she stops cold. Escobar is right at her back. They look at one another for a long moment and Gittes says nothing. She finishes looks plaintively at Gittes and Evelyn nods slightly as Escobar coughs. Gittes picks up the sheet and pulls it back revealing eyes open and a face that is badly cut and bruised. Gittes backs up turns off the motor the car lights and the spotlight. Alone light overhead on tension wires is the sole illumination. Gittes gets out of the car clubs the fence near the Flood channel itself. Lights from the reservoir still higher above can be seen. Gittes carefully works his way up through the thick foliage toward a second and large chainlink fence. He dives into the flood control channel which is at this point about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes loses himself among the ivy in the channel and starts to lift his head to catch the direction. Then he is inundated with a rush of water which pours over him knocks off his hat and carries him down the channel banging into its banks as he desperately tries to grab some of the overgrowth to hang on and pull himself out but the force of the stream batters him and carries him with it until he is brought rudely to the chainlink fence.

He dives into the flood control channel which is at this point about four feet deep and six feet wide. Gittes loses himself among the ivy in the channel and starts to lift his head to catch the direction. Then he is inundated with a rush of water which pours over him knocks off his hat and carries him down the channel banging into its banks as he desperately tries to grab some of the overgrowth to hang on and pull himself out but the force of the stream batters him and carries him with it until he is brought rudely to the chainlink fence.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: At this suggestion, the cat floats and peers through the window. Lorenzo notices the cat and overlooks the cat. Felicity glances up to find Dexter hovering in the window merely an inch or three from her, and she halts abruptly. Lorenzo is directly at her elbow. They gaze at one another for an extended second, and Dexter utters nothing. She concludes, glances sorrowfully at Dexter, and Felicity tilts slightly as Lorenzo sneezes. Dexter lifts the curtain and pushes it away, disclosing eyes closed and a surface that is neatly groomed and polished. They commence to glide quickly, and once more have to pause out of the path as some other statue is being rolled out of one of the Gardener booths. Jerry is rolling in another sculpture with the aid of a visitor. Jerry pulls away the cloak, brushes some snow from the figure's surface, and chuckles. As he begins to shift the sculpture into the cabinet, he falls into a joyful burst of sneezing and Jerry grins. The Sailor doesn't reply, but then winks. The dragon roars, and The Sailor floats quickly away. Dexter climbs down the ridge to inspect the path the pipe near Kensington Bridge takes. It is sloped toward the Evergreen Forest, where the moon is rising, along the mud path. It is bright now and Dexter trails the path with the bike headlamp. The trail is paved, with small groups of palm trees and cacti nowhere. Another twist unveils a triangle-shaped view of a sea of stars in the sky above, under the path, unchained. He moves at a crossroad in the path that permits him to keep trailing the mud path. The trail is broader and Dexter pedals more rapidly. The wooden log actually rises under the mud path and up into it, making entrance along the path itself possible. Dexter pedals forward, turns on the engine, the bike lights, and the headlamp. Many shadows overhead on electric lines are the sole darkness. Dexter dismounts the bike, kicks the gate near the Mud path itself. Shadows from the geyser still lower below can be heard. Dexter cautiously maneuvers his way down through the thin branches toward a first and small iron gate. He swims out of the mud containment path, which is at this moment about ten feet shallow and three feet narrow. Dexter finds himself beyond the roses in the path and begins to lower his head to smell the scent. Then he's swamped with a trickle of dust which drifts below him, brushes on his coat, and tugs him up the path, smoothing against its edges, as he casually attempts to touch some of the petals to hold on and push himself in, but the pull of the breeze soothes him and lets him go with it until he's taken softly to the iron gate.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Gittes stands in a doorway, capturing Evelyn's attention as she pauses, while Escobar is close behind her. They silently communicate until Gittes reveals a bruised face beneath a sheet. Morty wheels in another body, laughing as he deals with it. Gittes climbs an embankment to trace a storm drain's path towards the Hollywood Hills against the setting sun. As darkness falls, he follows a dirt road lined with trees, navigating around a chain-link fence that blocks the flood channel. Parking, Gittes leaves the car and approaches a higher chain-link fence, diving into the flood channel. He is swept away by rushing water, struggling to grab onto overgrowth as the current propels him to a fence.
